intro: Guettarda munizii, commonly known as the Brazilian guettarda, is a tropical shrub native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage. The plant produces small, white, fragrant flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its leaves are elliptical and have a glossy surface, while its fruits are small berries that turn red when mature. Guettarda munizii is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its attractive appearance and adaptability to various soil types.
